material.mattext: No sooner had the minister opened the bank…….the bank was filled to capacity.
when
for
as
than
A desperate man may clutch at a straw to save himself. This means
Seize any opportunity
Use a secret strategy
Try all clever means
Decide to act bravely
Neither the lawyer nor the client ….. at the court yesterday.
is
are
was
were
Which sentence is grammatically correct?
Me and my friend are going to the party.
My friend and me are going to the party.
My friend and I are going to the party.
The lecturer poured cold water on Emily’s suggestion. This means the lecturer
Left Emily’s suggestion
Approved Emily’s suggestion
Discouraged Emily’s suggestion
Provoked Emily
Cholera, tetanus and tuberculosis diseases are caused by …..
bactrials
bacterium
bacteria
bacterias
Which of these is correctly punctuated?
That French boy the one I mentioned previously, has been staring at me.
That French boy, the one I mentioned previously has been staring at me.
That French boy, the one I mentioned previously, has been staring at me.
Pick the odd one out.
She makes nice tote bags.
Nancy, is the best president we’ve ever had.
That is quite an old black watch.
Which is right?
A successful student’s qualities include: patience, determination, ambition.
The qualities to look out for include diligence, determination, and resilience.
I want to take courses such as: biology, chemistry, and physics.
The chief along with his family …… involved.
are
has
is
have
Either of the two candidates ….. eligible.
is
have
are
has been
Leading into a bullet-point list, which one of the following is correct?
We reported against our objectives as follows;
We reported against our objectives as follows:
We reported against our objectives as follows.
We reported against our objectives as follows,
Which sentence is correct?
The benefits of energy efficiency measures for farmers can be demonstrated with reliable, consistent and timely data, however, collecting such data is problematic.
The benefits of energy efficiency measures for farmers can be demonstrated with reliable, consistent and timely data. However collecting such data is problematic.
The benefits of energy efficiency measures for farmers can be demonstrated with reliable, consistent and timely data. However, collecting such data is problematic.
Which of these is correct?
The chair moved through the agenda quicker than usual.
The chair moved through the agenda more quickly than usual.
The chair moved through the agenda more quicker than usual.
Which sentence is punctuated correctly?
The cat orange and its name is Garfield.
The cat is orange, and it’s name is Garfield.
The cat is orange and its name is Garfield.
Choose the sentence with the correct placement of adverbs:
She quickly ran to the store.
She ran quickly to the store.
She ran to the store quickly.
Which sentence is punctuated correctly?
She told me, “I will be there in five minutes”.
She told me, “I will be there in five minutes.”
She told me “I will be there in five minutes.”
She told me “I will be there in five minutes”.
Identify the correct use of the apostrophe:
The students’ books were left on the desk.
The student’s’ books were left on the desk.
The students books were left on the desk.
The students books’ were left on the desk.
Choose the sentence that uses the correct pronoun case.
Him and I went to the movies last night.
He and me went to the movies last night.
He and I went to the movies last night.
Him and me went to the movies last night.
Identify the sentence that uses proper subject-verb agreement:
The pair of shoes was left on the floor.
The pair of shoes were left on the floor.
The pair of shoes is left on the floor.
The pair of shoes are left on the floor.
…… is taking someone else’s ideas or words and claiming them as your own
Copying
Summarising
Plagiarism
Stealing
What best describes the rightness or wrongness of plagiarism?
There is nothing wrong with it
In some situations, it is ok
Plagiarism is not a right or a wrong kind of thing
Always wrong because it is theft and fraud
Which of the following is not an example of plagiarism?
Borrowing an existing idea and presenting it as a new idea
Providing the full source for a quotation
Translating others’ written work into another language without citation
Changing a few words of a paragraph someone else wrote
It is acceptable to copy and paste a sentence written by someone else into your paper and simply add quotation marks around it.
True
False
Forgetting to cite a source in your paper is still plagiarism
True
False
It depends
Plagiarism is a major concern only in education
True
False
Which of the following requires proper citation?
When I include my own ideas that are unique to the paper I am writing
When I refer to my own papers that I have previously written
All of the above
None of the above
To paraphrase properly, you need to:
Change a few words and cite it to make it your own
Put quotation marks around the text and cite it
Use only idea from the text without citing it
Summarise the text in your own words and cite it

Say you found two papers about the same research: Paper A is the original finding; Paper B is an analysis that references Paper A. You use a section of the analysis from Paper B. Which paper do you cite?
Paper A
Paper B
Both
Which of the following requires proper citation?
When using information from crowd-sourced sources, like Wikipedia, because they are in the public domain
When using information that is considered common knowledge or widely accessible
None of the above
Which of the following is not a true purpose for citation?
Citation recognizes the authors you are referencing
Citation is used to distribute money for royalties
Citation allows your readers to confirm that you aren’t just making stuff up

For a class assignment that students are to complete individually, Student A and Student B decide to collaborate. Student A compiles research notes while Student B identifies the main findings. Both write their own original research papers, and neither cite the other’s work. Is this:
Unethical collaboration
Plagiarism
Both unethical collaboration and plagiarism
Acceptable collaboration
Which of the following are realistic consequences of plagiarism?
Ruined reputation
Being suspended or expelled from school
Losing money or job
All of the above
Proper citation
Helps your readers better understand the arguments you are making
Helps you provide additional evidence to back up your claims
Provides appropriate credit to those whose works you used
All of the above
In avoiding plagiarism, which of these do you give credit to?
words , phrases, quotations
Ideas, theories, or opinions
Charts, graphs, drawings, diagrams, music, art
Option And B only
All of the above
You cannot begin a sentence with your own words, then complete it with quoted words
True
False
Which of these is appropriate?
In the article “Why the Government Should Not Regulate Content Moderation of Social Media” by John Samples, he argues that private companies should be the ones policing speech on their platforms.
In the article “Why the Government Should Not Regulate Content Moderation of Social Media” by John Samples argues that private companies should be the ones policing speech on their platforms.
Both of them
None of the above
Though self-plagiarism is a form of plagiarism, it is not an academic offence
True
False
Which of the following actions can help prevent plagiarism?
Taking detailed notes during research.
Using a plagiarism checker to scan your paper
Properly citing all sources used in your paper
All of the above

A ……. is placed within the text and includes the authors’ last names and the publication year. A …… is placed at the end of a paper and includes information on the authors, year, the title of the source, and publication data to prevent plagiarism and give proper citation to work referred.
quotation; citation
reference list; quotation
Citation; reference list
reference list; citation
Plagiarism is:
a dangerous disease
an academic offence
an academic website
Avoiding plagiarism is needed for achieving perfection in academic writing
True
False
Sometimes
One may choose to write for all these reasons except:
To express an idea or a feeling on a topic
To answer a question the writer was given
To report research done by the writer
To show that one can come up with a piece of writing
Pick the odd one out:
Dissertation
Report
References
Article
The difference between a project and an essay is:
Essays are longer
Projects are longer
Students choose project’s topics
A list of all the sources the writer has mentioned in the text
Abstract
Main body
Findings
References
—-------- are used to give extra information.
Question marks
Brackets
Inverted commas
Abbreviations
It is not a good idea to acknowledge authors whose work you have referenced.
True
False
It depends
Which of these is not a reason to use references?
To help readers find the sources
To avoid plagiarism
To complete an assignment
Which of these is one reason abbreviations are used?
To save space
To give extra information
To acknowledge writers
